meanings.definition: To remove or draw out by suction.
meanings.sent1: The dentist suctioned the saliva during my teeth cleaning.
meanings.sent2: I suctioned the spilled milk off the floor with a vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was funny when I suctioned the toy from his hand.
meanings.sent4: She suctioned the secrets from his heart with her attentive listening.
meanings.sent5: The plumber suctioned the clog from the drain, making it flow smoothly again.

meanings.definition: To attach or hold by suction.
meanings.sent1: The octopus suctioned itself to the glass of the aquarium.
meanings.sent2: I suctioned the hook securely onto the wall to hang the painting.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum suctioned the dust bunnies with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes suctioned onto the beautiful painting in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The suctioned cup firmly held the glass tabletop in place.

meanings.definition: The act or process of using suction.
meanings.sent1: The suctioned helped clear the patient's airway during surgery.
meanings.sent2: We relied on the suctioned to clean the fish tank effectively.
meanings.sent3: The comical scene involved a mix-up with the suctioned at the car wash.
meanings.sent4: His charm had a magnetic suctioned that drew people to him.
meanings.sent5: The powerful suctioned of the vacuum made cleaning quick and easy.
